availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Peter J. Honaker (Henry County, Kentucky, farmer and justice of the peace)

body.p: Henry County, Kentucky, farmer and justice of the peace. Kentucky native. Married to Mary E. Rice in Owen County, Kentucky, on January 2, 1850. Father of Malinda Honaker. Married to Margaret A. White. Father of Peter J. Honaker. Farmer in Owen County in 1850. Owned one enslaved person in 1850. Justice of the Peace in Henry County in 1863.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Owen County, District 2, p. 211B.
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Owen County, District 2, p. 435.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Henry County, Port Royal, p. 371B.
Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Owen County Marriages, Film #001943449, p. 344.
Kentucky Birth, Marriage and Death Records – Microfilm (1852-1910), KDLA, Roll #994027-994058, Clark County Births, 1857, p. 5.
U.S. IRS Tax Assessment Lists, 1862-1918, NARA RG 58, Series M768, Roll 12, Kentucky, Henry County, District 3, December 1863 (accessed via Ancestry.com).
Vital Statistics Original Death Certificates – Microfilm (1911-1964), KDLA, Roll #7020621, All County Deaths, File #21418.
Find A Grave, "Peter J Honaker (1824-1890)," Memorial #88073759, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/88073759 (accessed May 17, 2020).
